headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; Rumored Election of Walker as President. REVOLUTION IN COSTA RICA. MEXICAN NEWS. The Indian Troubles in Oregon-Bloody Battles. Attempted Revolution against Walker by Rivas. SAFE ARRIVAL OF THE ORIZABA AT SAN JUAN. action of the Vigilance Commtitee Endorsed-Refusal of Gen. Wool to Deliver Arms to the Governer--More Rognes Banished. Magnatle Telegraph Co's Offfflest-5 Hanover-et., ISI Broadway. House Printing Telegraph- Office No.51 Wall-streat. By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. Important from California, Central America, Oregon and Mexico. Continuance of the Revolution in San Francisco. Arrival of the Daniel Webster at New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: The George Law left Aspinwall on the 5th with 350 passengers. The small shipment of gold by this arrival ($750,000) is accounted for by the unsettled condition of the country growing out of the recent action of the Vigilance Committee. At the latest moment of the steamer's sailing, all was quiet, but business affairs were nevertheless extremely dull-the attention of all parties being absorbed in the exciting occurrences of the day.'

headline.main: THE NEW KANSAS BILL.; SPEECH OF WILLIAM H. SEWARD AGAINST MR. DOUGLAS' SECOND ENABLING BILL, AND IN FAVOR OF The Immediate Admission of Kansas Into the Union.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. PRESIDENT: The daily sessions of the Senate usually last three or four hours. The present one has already reached its fourteenth hour. If I do not hasten, the gleams of the morning sun will pale the lights of the chandelier before I shall have closed my speech. The honorable and distinguished Senator from Kentucky (Mr. CRITTENDEN) has appealed eloquently and earnestly to my love of peace, and to my devotion to the Union.
docs.abstract: Speech against the Douglas enabling Bill

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN FRANCE.; Napoleon and the Cardinal--Another Farce-- The Bourbons--Relay of Princes--Political Orthography--The Bordertown Murat and the Legion of Honer--Scandal about Rachel-Lady Cowley, &c., &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: HOW NAPOLEON EXTINGUISHED THE OACDINAL. The Pope's Legate is confounded at the irreverent apathy of the Parisians in his presence. His eminence supposed, in his ignorance of the World's progress outside of Rome, that he had but to show himself in Paris to become at once the lion of the town.

headline.main: THE HERBERT TRIAL.; Trial of Hoh. Mr. Derbert for the Murder of Thomas Keating.

docs.lead_paragraph: Shortly after 10 o'clock yesterday morning, the prisoner was brought into Court and placed in the prisoner's box. Proper precaution had been taken to secure ventilation by throwing open the windows and doors. Within a few minutes after the opening of the Court room, it was filled with an audience whose deep interest in the proceedings was manifested by the silent tenacity with which they retained their tiresome standing positions.
